label: Jacobite Gold of Loch Arkaig (approx location)
column6: Bonnie Prince Charlie’s supporters hid French gold on the shores of Loch Arkaig.

label: Knights Templar Hoard at Temple Bruer
Summary: A secret vault beneath the medieval Templar preceptory reportedly conceals sacred relics and gold.

label: River Severn estuary - Viking Silver
Summary: Norse raiders are believed to have buried silver ingots on an island in the Severn Estuary. Treacherous mudflats and shifting sands keep the site well hidden.

label: Clogh Oughter Castle Treasure
column6: A 17th-century hoard of silver is said to lie somewhere in or around the island fortress on Lough Erne.

label: The Golden Axe Mystery
Summary: Six golden axe heads have been found around Alderly... how many have not been found.

label: Merlin’s Stone
Summary: Arthurian legend ties the wizard Merlin to Carmarthen
column6: hinting at a possible trove of magical relics or gold.

label: Urquhart Castle Loch Ness Gold
column11: Crusaders returning from the Holy Land purportedly donated gems to the cathedral treasury
column12: some of which vanished. Rumor says they remain walled up in an unused crypt.50.2736
column17: Local legend claims a mermaid left golden tokens for a human she loved. Folklore says a chest of her dowry lies hidden in sea caves near Zennor

label: The Oak Island Money Pit
Summary: Enduring mystery based on the story of treasure hidden in a deep pit
column6: sparking centuries of excavation attempts since its discovery in 1795. Despite numerous digs
column9: no confirmed treasure has been found.

label: Treasure of Lima
column7: allegedly stolen in 1820 by Captain William Thompson and buried on the island. Despite numerous treasure hunts over the centuries
column8: the treasure—estimated to be worth up to $208 million—has never been found    .
